meanings.definition: Organisms that cause biofouling on surfaces.
meanings.sent1: The biofoulers attached to the ship's hull were causing damage.
meanings.sent2: The scientists studied the biofoulers found on the rocks near the shore.
meanings.sent3: The biofoulers decided to have a party on the boat's bottom.
meanings.sent4: The biofoulers spread like wildfire, covering every inch of the structure.
meanings.sent5: The biofoulers transformed the once clean surface into a slimy mess.

meanings.sent1: The biofoulers of the barnacles caused the ship to slow down.
meanings.sent2: The biofoulers of algae made the pier slippery and dangerous.
meanings.sent3: The biofoulers of the mussels threw a surprise party on the buoy.
meanings.sent4: The biofoulers of bacteria crept slowly but steadily across the metal.
meanings.sent5: The biofoulers of seaweed tangled together, creating a messy web.

meanings.definition: The study of biofoulers and their impact on marine environments.
meanings.sent1: The biofoulers of the ocean were the focus of the marine biologist's research.
meanings.sent2: The biofoulers of the sea were a fascinating subject for the students to learn about.
meanings.sent3: The biofoulers of the deep sea held a conference to discuss their influence.
meanings.sent4: The biofoulers of the marine world revealed surprising secrets to the researchers.
meanings.sent5: The biofoulers of the underwater world painted a vivid picture of marine life.
